page.title: 16The Brynmaen Burial Ground
page.content: There is a{Quaker Burial Ground}in the grounds of 'Bwlchyddwyallt' (26/62), (formerly Brynmaen). It dates from 1698, and has been disused for many years. There are many references to the graveyard in 'The Carmarthenshire Antiquary' (esp.no.176-July 10th 1908) relating to the size-22ft by 24ft 8in, surrounded by a 5ft 6ins wall, this varies slightly with each mention. There are many notes on the upkeep, repairs and changes of ownership. In 1870 we learn that the Neath (West Glamorgan) Quakers, a strong church, were called upon to see the state of the graveyard. Mr. Frederick Gibbons came and entrusted the repair of the walls and the placing of a strong iron gate (Still there today) to the tenant of Brynmaen,John Thomas. The gate is inscribed with the words 'Friends Burial Ground 1870'
